title: Objects of desire: Hong Kong suit
text:
Made to measure: buy a bargain bespoke suit in Hong Kong (Getty) Years ago, you could walk out of the Peninsula hotel in Hong Kong on Friday afternoon, get measured for two suits and 12 shirts, nip back for a fitting on Sunday, have the whole order delivered on Monday and pay peanuts.
Like so many of Hong Kong’s shopping experiences, that has changed. The number of tailors has dropped from 50,000 to a few hundred, their average age is about 65, and delivery times have gone up, meaning that the final product is usually sent on by courier. But while the shortage of skilled labour is pushing prices up, it’s still a bargain — from about £300 for a bespoke suit.
